venue.name: Boston Public Library at Copley Square

item.description:
Bring your appetite and dancing shoes, but leave the library card at home! The Boston Society of Architects (BSA) is throwing the party of the season in honor of the AIA National Convention and you're invited.

Arrive in Copley Square, just opposite Richardson's Trinity Church and Pei/Cobb's John Hancock Tower. Enjoy the iconic Boston Public Library, McKim's masterpiece and Boston's gift to all people. Toast the 162 young professionals who received BSA scholarships and free AIA Convention registration in our Design Forward Lounge. A portion of the proceeds of this event will support the BSA's public education programs.

Enjoy the library's intimate courtyard, its famed reading room, fine food, music and more. We guarantee an unforgettable evening! A portion of the proceeds of this event will support the BSA's public education programs.

Sponsored by Cubellis in association with DiCicco, Gulman & Company, Lawson & Weitzen and Sovereign Bank.

**Please note, you MUST purchase tickets ($150 per person) at http://www.architects... to RSVP! You do not have to be a BSA/AIA member or AIA Convention attendee to come.**
item.why: How often will be you be able to say you lived it up at the BPL? Come mingle with other like-minded professionals from throughout the country.
item.name: BSA Host Chapter Party at Boston Public Library
